title: Welcome to pgLang (Visual Mission Statement)
lyrics:
18 Contributors
Welcome to pgLang (Visual Mission Statement) Lyrics
“Welcome to pgLang” is a visual mission statement written, directed, and executive-produced by Dave Free, with executive production and appearances by Kendrick Lamar. The short film also casts Baby Keem… Read More 
[Part I]

[Yara Shahidi]
(Laughs) What are you doing?

[Baby Keem]
Watchin' the sun.

[Yara Shahidi]
Yeah? Why are you watching the sun?

[Baby Keem]
I’ve always wondered why people say we shouldn't stare at this powerful source of energy. Made me curious.

[Yara Shahidi]
What if you go blind?

[Baby Keem]
I've never heard of anyone goin’ blind from starin' at the Sun.

[Yara Shahidi]
Guess you got a point there. Have you seen anything yet?

[Baby Keem]
Many things.



[Yara Shahidi]
Like what?

[Baby Keem]
See for yourself. You should turn off the phone.

[Baby Keem]
Welcome to the present.

[Part II]

[Intro: Kendrick Lamar]
Too many opinions in the glasshouse
This world full of ego, let me cash out


[Chorus: Baby Keem]
Jump in that—, jump in that bitch (Ho)
Jump in that— (Ho), jump in that bitch (Ho)
Jump in that— (Ho, ho), jump in that—
(Jump in that bitch)
(Fuck nigga)
Jump in that bitch, run in that bitch
Jump in that-jump in that bitch


[Verse: Baby Keem & Kendrick Lamar]

Two trench coats in the bag
Baby Keem, king of rap
And I think he just came back
How the fuck did I go back? (pgLang)
Get your case off my back (pgLang)
That my son, wait, relax (It's the language)
Beat my son, go to your room (pgLang, pgLang)
Stop sneak-dissin', that ain't bool
Play both sides, huh
She love all my guys, huh



[Part III]

[Spoken Word: Eckhart Tolle & Baby Keem]
As we grow up, we begin to identify with things (Bitch). Which means, identify means, we divide all sense of who we are from certain things. When you're identified with something that you are not, it always leads to suffering and unhappiness.

[Part IV]

[Jorja Smith]
I wonder what he's thinking about up there. Or if he's even thinkin’ at all.


[Outro: Florence Welch]
Oh, oh, oh
Oh, oh, oh, oh
Oh, oh, oh, oh (On to each other)
Oh, oh, oh, oh (On to each other)
